meanings.definition: To move gently back and forth or from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The baby was rocking in the cradle.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys rocking on her favorite chair.
meanings.sent3: The boat was rocking gently on the calm water.
meanings.sent4: The trees were rocking in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The swing set was rocking back and forth with each push.

meanings.definition: A style of music characterized by a strong beat and simple melodies.
meanings.sent1: The band played some energetic rocking tunes.
meanings.sent2: She loves listening to classic rock music.
meanings.sent3: The party was lively with the sound of rocking music.
meanings.sent4: The concert was filled with the rocking rhythm of the drums.
meanings.sent5: The radio station always plays the best rocking songs.

meanings.definition: A large mass of stone forming a hill, cliff, or other natural feature.
meanings.sent1: The hikers admired the towering rocking formation.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a beautiful landscape with a prominent rocking in the background.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the rocking was a giant monster in their game.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were surrounded by massive rocking formations.
meanings.sent5: The sunset cast a warm glow on the rugged rocking of the mountain.
